title: alexander hamilton
content: 'alexander hamilton' (1901), biography of the american founding father by charles a. conant. alexander hamilton was an influential interpreter and promoter of the u.s. constitution, as well as the founder of the nation's financial system, the federalist party, the united states coast guard, and the new york post newspaper. as the first secretary of the treasury, hamilton was the main author of the economic policies of the george washington administration.
